episodeTitle: A Farewell to Arms! Pirates and Different Ideas of Justice!
description: In the aftermath of Crocodile's defeat, rain finally returns to Arabasta. Kappa testifies that Mr. 2 Bon Kurei impersonated King Cobra, clearing the king's name. The Marines arrive to arrest Crocodile and strip him of his Warlord status, but the World Government attempts to cover up the Straw Hats' role in his defeat, leading to conflicts about justice between Marine officers.

events.title: Rain Returns to Arabasta
events.description: After years of drought, rain finally falls on Arabasta following Crocodile's defeat. The people of Arabasta see the rain as a sign that their nightmare is ending, though many remain skeptical about what truly happened.
events.significance: Symbolizes the end of Crocodile's reign of terror and the beginning of Arabasta's recovery. The rain is both literal relief and symbolic catharsis for the kingdom.

quotes.text: It's raining! The rain has finally come!
quotes.speaker: Arabasta Citizens
quotes.context: The people's first reaction to seeing rain after years of drought

events.title: Kappa's Testimony About Bon Clay's Impersonation
events.description: Igaram presents Kappa, the young boy who was injured in Nanohana, who testifies that Mr. 2 Bon Kurei impersonated King Cobra and ordered the Royal Army to attack innocent civilians. This revelation clears King Cobra's name and exposes Crocodile's deception.
events.significance: Provides crucial evidence that clears the king's name and helps the people of Arabasta understand the true nature of the conspiracy. This testimony is essential for the kingdom's healing and reconciliation.

quotes.text: That wasn't the real King Cobra! It was that Baroque Works agent, Mr. 2 Bon Kurei, who can turn into anyone!
quotes.speaker: Kappa
quotes.context: Kappa's crucial testimony exposing Bon Clay's impersonation

events.title: People of Arabasta Lay Down Their Arms
events.description: After hearing Kappa's testimony and understanding the truth about Crocodile's conspiracy, the citizens of Arabasta finally agree to throw down their weapons for good, ending the rebellion and beginning the path to peace.
events.significance: Marks the official end of the civil war in Arabasta. The people choosing to disarm represents their trust being restored and their commitment to rebuilding together.

events.title: Hina's Debut
events.description: Captain Hina of the Marines makes her first appearance at the port town of Tamarisk, where she greets Smoker and his unit. She is revealed to be an old friend of Smoker's from their days at the Marine Academy, addressing him casually as 'Smoker-kun'.
events.significance: Introduces a recurring Marine character who represents a different approach to justice than Smoker. Hina serves as a bridge between the rebellious Smoker and the Marine establishment.

quotes.speaker: Hina
quotes.context: Hina's casual greeting to Smoker, showing their long friendship

events.title: Marines Arrive at Tamarisk
events.description: Smoker, Tashigi, and their Marine unit arrive at the port town of Tamarisk, where they are greeted by Captain Hina. The town serves as the departure point from Arabasta.
events.significance: Establishes Tamarisk as the location where the Marines regroup after the Arabasta incident and where the conflict about justice and promotions takes place.

events.title: World Government Cover-Up Revealed
events.description: Marine Headquarters contacts Smoker and Tashigi, crediting them with Crocodile's defeat and offering promotions, despite knowing the Straw Hat Pirates actually defeated him. Hina explains that the World Government wants to cover up the pirates' involvement to avoid embarrassment.
events.significance: Reveals the corrupt nature of the World Government and their willingness to falsify events for political purposes. This is a pivotal moment that shapes Smoker and Tashigi's views on justice and foreshadows future conflicts between principled Marines and the establishment.

quotes.text: The World Government has decided to cover up the Straw Hats' involvement. They can't let it be known that pirates saved a kingdom when the Marines couldn't.
quotes.speaker: Hina
quotes.context: Hina explaining the government's decision to Smoker

events.title: Smoker Refuses Promotion and Denounces Cover-Up
events.description: Smoker angrily rejects the promotion offered by Marine Headquarters, furiously telling the officials to 'go eat shit' and declaring that acknowledging the truth is 'real justice.' He refuses to take credit for the Straw Hats' actions.
events.significance: Defines Smoker's character as a Marine who values truth and personal honor over rank and politics. This moment establishes him as fundamentally different from typical Marine officers and sets up his future role as a maverick within the organization. It's a defining moment for the concept of justice in One Piece.

quotes.text: Tell those bastards at headquarters they can go eat shit! This is real justice!
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker's furious rejection of the promotion and cover-up

events.title: Tashigi's Crisis of Justice
events.description: Tashigi struggles internally with conflicting emotions about helping the Straw Hat Pirates. She feels it's a disgrace to have aided pirates, even though they were fighting for the right cause. Her sense of what constitutes 'justice' is deeply shaken.
events.significance: Illustrates the moral complexity of the One Piece world where pirates can be heroes and the government can be corrupt. Tashigi's struggle represents the challenge faced by honorable people working within flawed systems. This is a key moment in her character development.

quotes.text: How can we call ourselves Marines when we had to rely on pirates to save a kingdom? What is true justice?
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Tashigi's internal struggle with her role in the Arabasta incident

events.title: Smoker Advises Tashigi to Become Stronger
events.description: Smoker tells Tashigi that instead of dwelling on the moral complexities, she should focus on becoming stronger so she can uphold her own sense of justice. He encourages her to use this experience as motivation rather than let it defeat her.
events.significance: Shows Smoker's mentorship role and his philosophy that personal strength enables personal justice. This advice will influence Tashigi's development and her determination to become stronger.

quotes.text: Become stronger, Tashigi. That's the only way you'll be able to uphold your own justice.
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker's advice to Tashigi about how to move forward

events.title: Crocodile Stripped of Warlord Title
events.description: With evidence of confiscated Dance Powder ships linked to Crocodile, the Marines officially strip him of his Warlord of the Sea title and place him under arrest. This marks the fall of one of the Seven Warlords.
events.significance: Major political shift in the world's power balance. Crocodile losing his Warlord status creates a vacancy in the Seven Warlords system and demonstrates that even government-sanctioned pirates can fall from grace.

quotes.text: Crocodile, you are hereby stripped of your title as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea and placed under arrest.
quotes.speaker: Tashigi

events.title: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei Escapes Alubarna
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei manages to escape from Alubarna, avoiding capture by the Marines. Despite his role in the conspiracy, he slips away in the chaos.
events.significance: Sets up Bon Clay's future appearances and demonstrates that not all Baroque Works agents were captured. His escape is important for later story developments.

events.title: Straw Hats Recuperate at the Palace
events.description: That evening at the palace, the Straw Hat Pirates rest and recover from their injuries sustained during the battles against Baroque Works. They are being treated as honored guests despite being wanted pirates.
events.significance: Shows the aftermath of the intense battles and the crew's need for recovery. Also demonstrates the unusual situation where pirates are welcomed in a royal palace.

events.title: Vivi Watches the Rain
events.description: Vivi stands in the rain, watching it fall over her kingdom for the first time in years. The moment is deeply emotional for her as she reflects on everything that has happened and the hope for her kingdom's future.
events.significance: Symbolic moment representing Vivi's relief, gratitude, and hope. The rain washing over her represents the cleansing of Arabasta and the beginning of a new chapter.

quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker's furious rejection of the promotion and cover-up

quotes.speaker: Smoker

themes.description: The episode explores different perspectives on justice through the Marines' reactions to the Arabasta incident. Smoker represents personal justice based on truth, Tashigi struggles with institutional vs. moral justice, and the World Government represents political expediency over truth.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between the corrupt cover-up and Smoker's honest rage symbolizes the fundamental tension between doing what's right and following orders.

themes.description: After the intense battles, both the kingdom of Arabasta and the Straw Hat crew need time to recover. The rain serves as a symbol of cleansing and renewal.
themes.symbolism: The rain represents both literal relief from drought and symbolic washing away of the kingdom's troubles, allowing for a fresh start.

themes.description: The World Government's decision to cover up the truth and take credit for the Straw Hats' actions reveals the corrupt nature of the world's ruling powers.
themes.symbolism: The false promotion offered to Smoker and Tashigi represents how the government manipulates truth for political gain.

characterSpotlights.development: Smoker demonstrates his unwavering commitment to truth and justice, even when it means defying Marine Headquarters. His refusal to accept false credit and his advice to Tashigi showcase his principled nature.
keyActions: Maintains his personal code of justice

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of Hina, who will become a recurring Marine character throughout the series.
The episode's TV rating was 14.1%, ranking #3 for the week in Japan.
An animation inconsistency was noted where Vivi was shown wearing her wedges despite them being broken in previous episodes.
This is the final episode to use 'Shining ray' by Janne Da Arc as the ending theme.
Smoker's famous line telling headquarters to 'go eat shit' is one of the most quoted Marine moments in the series and establishes his character as fundamentally different from typical Marines.
